title: Changing power - graphing work as function of time

content.question: A motor is used to lift a platform as shown between the times <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The power supplied by the motor is given by <math alttext="P equals, A minus B t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="A equals 6 watts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math> and <math alttext="B equals 2 watts per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>W/s</mtext></math>. Which of the following graphs could represent the work done on the platform by the motor as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules.” The line begins at 0 seconds approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis and moves straight to the right horizontally and ends at 3 seconds and the same height.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in a plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules.” The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply, and ends at 3 seconds and approximately three quarters of the height of the vertical axis.

The figure shows a graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules.” The line begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right, and ends at 3 seconds and approximately three quarters of the height of the vertical axis.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules.” The curve begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends at 3 seconds and approximately three quarters of the height of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0 and 3 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules.” The curve begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends at 3 seconds and approximately three quarters of the height of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
